intro: Beaumontia brevituba, commonly known as the short-stemmed beaumontia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually elliptical in shape. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and they attract various pollinators such as bees and birds.
